text:
I installed _oauthlib_ 2.0.1 using the virtual environment support in the _pyCharm_ IDE. When running a short test program, I get an exception from _oauthlib/oauth1/rfc5859/signature.py_ line 473 where it tries to execute:

    import jwt.algorithms as jwtalgo

I've installed a module called "jwt" version 0.3.2 and that didn't solve the problem. Obviously that is not the JWT module it expects to be using, since it doesn't have an algorithms module.

**Which JWT module does _oauthlib_ depend upon**, because there's about 30 different modules available with the word "jwt" in their name!

It would be good if this was documented in the installation instructions. Thanks.
title: Which JWT module does oauthlib depend upon?
Which JWT module does oauthlib depend upon?

text: Never mind. I found the answer in the "_OAuth 2 ServiceApplicationClient and OAuth 1 with RSA-SHA1 signatures say “could not import jwt”. What should I do?_" question at <https://oauthlib.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq.html>
